question.title: Eclipse is only allowing maven not java
question.body:
I am running into what I hope is a very simple problem. I have downloaded eclipse, installed it, opened an existing project. The project had some errors and I ended up removing the project from the file explorer on the left. I wanted to start fresh. Now it is only letting me create new Maven projects. When I try to use any of the icons for new projects or files, or if I go to the top and select file--> new it is only allowing Maven. I would only like to create java projects. I have never run into this problem before and I do not know what I have done to cause this problem or how to get out of it. How do I get back to just making java projects?

This is what the screen looks like

answers.body:
These menus depend on a selected "perspective". You have selected Java EE perspective, but it is no longer installed and fails to work properly. Select Java perspective instead.

Perspectives can be changed by clicking on buttons at the top-right corner of the window.

question_comments.body: This question is similar to: How to switch between Eclipse plugin?. If you believe it’s different, please edit the question, make it clear how it’s different and/or how the answers on that question are not helpful for your problem.
Thank you howlger, that was the issue and it seems to resolve it.

The perspective icon in the upper right corner on the screenshot shows that something is completely wrong with the perspective. Most likely this is also causing the limited new menu here. Close the perspective and recreate it.

What is shown in the File > New menu directly (and not only in File > New > Other...) depends on the actual perspective (which can be chosen in Window > Perspective). According to your screenshot, your actual perspective is Java EE. It seems you have switched from the Eclipse IDE for Enterprise Java and Web Developers to the Eclipse IDE for Java Developers which does not support the Java EE perspective. Click the button in the upper right corner to switch to the Java perspective or choose a different supported perspective via Window > Perspective.

You haven't shown the the screenshot of the dialog that is being opened, when you select "File" -> "New" -> "Other...". Instead you have shown the menu item itself from the menu. Also, there is a "Project..." menu item you can use.
Is there a particular reason you don't want to use Maven (or Gradle)?
It's probably doing you a favour. You should always use Maven or Gradle with Eclipse
